mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Map of the exterior boundaries and official locations of Ranchos San Jose addition to San Jose and Azusa

mods:mods.mods:note: "Compiled from maps and exhibits on file in the Office of the Surveyor General of California and from surveys made by Hancock, Thompson & Wheeler, U.S. Deputy Surveyor
Manuscript map on linen
Boundaries are over colored in blue, brown, green, pink and yellow tint
Relief shown by hachures
Rancho San Jose comprised what is now the present day city of Pomona and environs
Rancho Azusa de Dalton (not to be confused with Rancho Azusa de Duarte to the west), extended from as far east as what is now Pomona and as far west as what is now Arcadia
UCLA copy: Ex libris W.W. Robinson. Cf. Robinson #71

In 1887, the Lankershim Ranch Land and Water Company of San Fernando Valley, California purchased a 12,000 acre ranch from J. B. Lankershim aned I. N. Van Nuys. The property, running from Whitsett Avenue on the west, to the Burbank city limits on the East, and from the skyline of the Hollywood Hills on the south
